description:
versions: essex (2012.1) and grizzly (2013.1)

The use of "_set_instance_error_state" function seems to be inconsistent in nova/compute/manager.py. For example, when a "nova boot" command fails, the VM may end in ERROR state due to the use of "_set_instance_error_state". If a "nova reboot" fails, however, "_set_instance_error_state" is not called and VM will not be set to ERROR. 

We think that the VM should be set to ERROR in both cases.
title: seemingly inconsistent use of _set_instance_error_state in nova/compute/manager.py
